meanings.meaning_en_US: To start over and rethink a plan or idea after a failure.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在失敗後重新開始並重新考慮計劃或想法

examples.sentence: After the proposal was rejected, it was time to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 提議被拒絕後，是時候重新開始並重新考慮計劃。

examples.sentence: The first attempt didn't work, so we need to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 第一次嘗試沒有成功，所以我們需要重新考慮計劃。

examples.sentence: Let's [go back to the drawing board] and come up with a new strategy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們重新開始並提出新策略。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To sound more threatening than one really is.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽起來比實際上更具威脅性

examples.sentence: Don’t be scared, he’s just [barking worse than his bite].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要害怕，他只是聽起來比實際上更具威脅性。

examples.sentence: She may seem aggressive, but she actually [barks worse than she bites].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她看起來可能有點具攻擊性，但她實際上只是聽起來威脅。

examples.sentence: He often [barks worse than he bites] when he feels insecure.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他感到不安時，他經常聽起來比實際上更具威脅性。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pursue a mistaken or misguided course of action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追求錯誤或誤導的行動路徑

examples.sentence: If you think I took your book, you are [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為是我拿了你的書，你就追求錯誤的行動路徑。

examples.sentence: He was [barking up the wrong tree] when he accused her of lying.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他指責她說謊時，他追求了錯誤的行動路徑。

examples.sentence: Think twice before acting; you might be [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 行動前再想清楚；你可能在追求錯誤的行動路徑。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something before someone else does.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在別人之前先做某事

examples.sentence: I wanted to ask her out, but he [beat me to the punch].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想約她，但他在我之前先做了。

examples.sentence: He made a great offer on the house, [beating us to the punch].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對那座房子提出了很好的報價，先於我們。

examples.sentence: They [beat us to the punch] with their new product launch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的產品發布先於我們。

meanings.meaning_en_US: People with little choice must accept what is offered.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的

examples.sentence: If you're asking for help, remember: [beggars can’t be choosers].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你在尋求幫助，記住：沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的。

examples.sentence: After losing his job, he realized [beggars can’t be choosers].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在失去工作後，他意識到了沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的。

examples.sentence: She knew that [beggars can’t be choosers] when she took the old car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的，當她接受了那輛舊車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who is different from others in a family or group, often in a negative way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在家庭或團體中，與他人不同的人，通常是負面方式

examples.sentence: Everyone in her family is a doctor, but she is the [black sheep].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她家裡每個人都是醫生，但她是家庭的黑羊。

examples.sentence: Looking back, I was always the [black sheep of the family].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 回首過去，我一直是家庭的黑羊。

examples.sentence: In a family of artists, he felt like the [black sheep].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一個藝術家家庭中，他感到自己是家庭的黑羊。

word: by the seat of your pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something without a plan or guide, relying on instinct or intuition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在沒有計劃或指南的情況下行事，依靠本能或直覺

examples.sentence: I had to figure it out [by the seat of my pants] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，我只能依靠本能來解決問題。

examples.sentence: He made the presentation [by the seat of his pants] and it surprisingly went well.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他隨興發表了那個演示，結果出乎意料地順利。

examples.sentence: We had to navigate our trip [by the seat of our pants] since we lost the map.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為我們丟了地圖，我們不得不靈機應變地導航。

word: by the skin of your teeth

meanings.meaning_en_US: To narrowly escape or succeed, just barely.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 僥倖逃脫或成功，差得很少

examples.sentence: I passed the exam [by the skin of my teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我僥倖通過了考試。

examples.sentence: They won the game [by the skin of their teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們僥倖贏得了比賽。

examples.sentence: He escaped from the accident [by the skin of his teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他僥倖逃脫事故。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A method of persuasion that uses rewards and punishments.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一種使用獎勵和懲罰的說服方法

examples.sentence: The manager uses a [carrot and stick approach] to motivate the team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經理用獎勵和懲罰的方法來激勵團隊。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, she applied the [carrot and stick approach] effectively.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，她有效地使用了獎勵和懲罰的方法。

examples.sentence: The government’s [carrot and stick approach] aimed to encourage compliance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 政府的獎勵和懲罰的方法旨在鼓勵遵從。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To find oneself unable to choose between two options.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇

examples.sentence: I feel [caught between two stools] when deciding on my career path.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在決定我的職業道路時，我感到無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇。

examples.sentence: She was [caught between two stools] when her friends wanted different plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的朋友們想要不同的計劃時，她無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇。

examples.sentence: Being [caught between two stools] is frustrating for me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 被迫在兩個選擇之間是令人沮喪的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't assume success or a positive outcome before it happens.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在成功之前不要假設成功或正面結果

examples.sentence: You shouldn't [count your chickens] before the project is complete.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該在項目完成之前假設成功。

examples.sentence: He already spent the prize money, but I told him not to [count his chickens].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已經花了獎金，但我告訴他不要假設成功。

examples.sentence: Don't [count your chickens] until you have the contract signed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在你簽署合同之前不要假設成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't make a judgment before knowing all of the facts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在了解所有事實之前不要做出判斷

examples.sentence: Please don’t [jump to conclusions] before hearing his side of the story.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在聽到他的講述之前請不要急於下結論。

examples.sentence: If you [jump to conclusions], you might misinterpret the situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果急於下結論，你可能會誤解情況。

examples.sentence: We need to gather more information and not [jump to conclusions].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要收集更多資訊，而不是急於下結論。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To irritate or annoy someone significantly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某人感到極度惱怒或煩躁

examples.sentence: Her constant talking is starting to [drive me up the wall].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不斷的講話開始讓我感到極度煩躁。

examples.sentence: He’s been [driving everyone up the wall] with his complaints.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他一直因為抱怨而讓每個人感到煩躁。

examples.sentence: Don’t [drive me up the wall] with your excuses.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要用你的藉口讓我感到煩躁。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel very good or in excellent health.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感覺非常好或健康狀況極佳

examples.sentence: After a good night's sleep, I really [feel like a million bucks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過一整晚的好睡眠，我真的感覺很好。

examples.sentence: She smiled and said she [felt like a million bucks] after the workout.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她微笑著說運動後她感覺很好。

examples.sentence: Once I got dressed, I [felt like a million bucks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦我穿好衣服，我感覺很好。

synonyms: be on top of the world

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel ill or unwell.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感到生病或不舒服

examples.sentence: I’ve been [feeling under the weather] this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我這個星期一直感到不舒服。

examples.sentence: She stayed home because she was [feeling under the weather].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為感到不舒服而留在家裡。

examples.sentence: If you’re [feeling under the weather], you should rest.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你感到不舒服，你應該休息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Every part of the world.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 世界的每一個地方

examples.sentence: People travel from the [four corners of the earth] to see this event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們從世界的各個角落來參加這個活動。

examples.sentence: The festival attracts visitors from the [four corners of the earth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個節日吸引來自世界各地的遊客。

examples.sentence: He claimed to have traveled to the [four corners of the earth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他聲稱自己已經去過世界的每一個角落。

word: get off on the right foot

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start something well.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 良好地開始某事

examples.sentence: She [got off on the right foot] with her new boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她和新老闆打下了良好的基礎。

examples.sentence: Their project [got off on the right foot] after the initial meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的計劃在初次會議後良好開始。

examples.sentence: Let’s ensure we [get off on the right foot] for the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們確保在演示中有個良好的開始。

word: get off on the wrong foot

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start something poorly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不良地開始某事

examples.sentence: He [got off on the wrong foot] with his teammates.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他和隊友不佳開場。

examples.sentence: Their presentation [got off on the wrong foot] due to technical issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的演示因技術問題開始不順利。

examples.sentence: We can't afford to [get off on the wrong foot] for this project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們不能讓這個項目開個壞頭。

word: give a piece of your mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express one's discontent or anger about a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表達對某情況的不滿或憤怒

examples.sentence: She was so upset that she [gave a piece of her mind] to her boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她非常生氣，對她的老闆發表了不滿。

examples.sentence: He decided to [give a piece of his mind] regarding the unfair treatment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定對不公平的對待表達不滿。

examples.sentence: After the meeting, she [gave a piece of her mind] about the poor decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會後，她對這些糟糕的決策表達了不滿。

word: if the shoe fits, wear it

meanings.meaning_en_US: If something applies to you, then acknowledge it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 若某事適用於你，則應承認它

examples.sentence: If you think that description fits you, then [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為那個描述適用於你，那就承認吧。

examples.sentence: He said some harsh things, but if the truth hurts, [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他說了一些苛刻的話，但如果真相會傷害到你，那就承認吧。

examples.sentence: She told me to think about it and [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她告訴我思考一下，若適用就承認。
